definition: another name for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼佛|释迦牟尼佛, the historical Buddha

sentences.english: The sutra is full of narratives and episodes as well as the direct utterances of the Exalted One Himself.
sentences.chinese: 佛经中充满了叙述和插曲和释尊直接的言论。

definition: Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)/Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism
World Honored One/Revered One of the World (Buddha)
Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)/Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism
Buddha (a person who has attained Buddhahood, or specifically Siddhartha Gautama)
Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism/Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)
Prince Ananda, cousin of the Buddha and his closest disciple
to extinguish worries and the sea of grief/nirvana (Buddhism)
(of a deity) to take a material shape/to appear
Kṣitigarbha Bodhisattva, the Bodhisattva of the Great Vow (to save all souls before accepting Bodhi)/also translated Earth Treasury, Earth Womb, or Earth Store Bodhisattva
Sakya (name of a north Indian tribe)/abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼 Sakyamuni Buddha/sugar apple
Prince Ananda, cousin of the Buddha and his closest disciple
Manjushri, the Bodhisattva of keen awareness
